intro: Cyrtandra quiritis, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. Cyrtandra quiritis is an important component of the native Hawaiian flora, contributing to the unique biodiversity of the region. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
